eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.framework

Class ShallowParserBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.shallowparser.framework.ShallowParserBase<STATE>
  • Type Parameters:
    STATE - the enum used for describing parse states.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IShallowParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbapShallowParser, AdaShallowParser, CobolShallowParser, CStyleShallowParserBase, DelphiShallowParser, FortranShallowParser, GosuShallowParser, GroovyShallowParser, HanaSQLScriptShallowParser, Iec61131ShallowParser, JavaScriptShallowParser, KotlinShallowParser, LineShallowParser, MatlabShallowParser, OcamlShallowParser, OScriptShallowParser, PhpShallowParser, PlsqlShallowParser, PythonShallowParser, RubyShallowParser, RustShallowParser, SwiftShallowParser, TsqlShallowParser, VisualBasicShallowParser, XtendShallowParser

    public abstract class ShallowParserBase<STATE extends java.lang.Enum<STATE>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IShallowParser
    Base class for shallow parsers that implements most of the generic parsing logic.

      • isFilteredToken

        protected boolean isFilteredToken(IToken token,
                                  IToken previousToken)
        Template method that can be used to ignore/filter certain tokens. Default implementation ignores comments.
        Parameters:
        previousToken - the last non-filtered token (can be used for context sensitive filtering). This may be null is no previous token exists.

      • parseTopLevel

        public java.util.List<ShallowEntity> parseTopLevel(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Shallow parses the given list of tokens and returns all entities found. The tokens provided are expected to represent an entire top-level element of the language (typically a file).
        Specified by:
        parseTopLevel in interface IShallowParser

      • parseFragment

        public java.util.List<ShallowEntity> parseFragment(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Shallow parses the given list of tokens and returns all entities found. The tokens provided may be from an arbitrary contiguous chunk of source code.

        This works by attempting to parse from all possible states and returns the best result, where 'best' is measured in terms of completed entities.

        Specified by:
        parseFragment in interface IShallowParser

      • filterTokens

        protected java.util.List<IToken> filterTokens(java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Creates a filtered view of the tokens.

      • parse

        protected java.util.List<ShallowEntity> parse(STATE startState,
                                              java.util.List<IToken> tokens)
        Performs a shallow parse for the given list of tokens and given initial state.

      • endWithPossibleContinuation

        protected void endWithPossibleContinuation(RecognizerBase<STATE> recognizer,
                                           java.util.EnumSet<ETokenType> continuationTokens)
        Completes a recognizer with an end. If the next token is one of the provided continuation tokens, the entity creation finishes with a continued node.
        Parameters:
        continuationTokens - list of tokens that indicate a continued statement if encountered at the end. May be null.
